titlestmt.titleproper: Medical illustrations for Harvey Cushing by Mildred Codding and others
Medical illustrations for Harvey Cushing by Mildred Codding and others
titlestmt.author: Emma Brennan-Wydra

publicationstmt.publisher: Medical Historical Library, Harvey Cushing / John Hay Whitney Medical Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday February 5, 2019 at 03:00

did.unittitle: Medical illustrations for Harvey Cushing by Mildred Codding and others

repository.corpname: Medical Historical Library, Harvey Cushing / John Hay Whitney Medical Library

langmaterial.language: Primarily English, with small amounts of French, German, and Chinese.

did.abstract: This collection contains illustrations (both early sketches and proofs) done for Harvey Cushing, as well as notes, correspondence, photographic reprints, and other materials relating to the production of Cushing and Eisenhardt's 1938 monograph Meningiomas . The majority of the illustrations were done by Mildred Codding, who was Cushing's illustrator from 1929 until his retirement in 1932. Several illustrations by others, including M. Warner, are also included in this collection.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: This collection is comprised of materials from three separate gifts to the Historical Library, donated by Gloria Robinson (2012) and Dorothy Robinson (2017) from the collection of Dr. Franklin Robinson, and by Michael Hand from the estate of his sister, Rosalie Marie Hand (2013).

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into four series: I. Proofs from Meningiomas by Codding. II. Notes and other materials relating to Meningiomas . III. Illustrations from other publications by Codding. IV. Illustrations for Harvey Cushing by others.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Mildred Codding (1902-1991) was the medical illustrator for Dr. Harvey Cushing from 1929 until his retirement in 1932. Her illustrations feature prominently in many of Dr. Cushing's publications, including his 1938 monograph Meningiomas .

A native of Somerville, Massachusetts, Codding graduated from Wellesley College in 1924 and earned a master's degree in zoology from Columbia University in 1926. In 1928, she began to train as a medical illustrator at Johns Hopkins University under Dr. Max Br√∂del, the pioneer of the "carbon dust" technique commonly used in 20th century medical and scientific illustrations. After just one year of study, Codding was selected to begin part-time work with Dr. Cushing in 1929. In a later interview, Codding stated that Cushing, who was a talented illustrator in his own right and highly particular in general, "was not easy to illustrate for."

After Cushing's retirement to Yale University in 1933, Codding stayed on at the Brigham Hospital in Boston, where she did operative photography for Dr. John Homans and Dr. David Cheever. She resumed drawing with Dr. Elliott Cutler and Dr. Robert Zollinger, providing the illustrations for their Atlas of Surgical Operations , published in 1939. Codding's next major work was the Atlas of Pelvic Operations , published in 1953 by Dr. Langdon Parsons and Dr. Howard Ulfelder of Massachusetts General Hospital. Later, she worked with Dr. Donald Matson and Dr. John Shillito of the Brigham and Children's Hospitals, illustrating pediatric neurosurgical operations. Codding left the Brigham in 1968, but continued to work with Dr. Shillito for the next 12 years on his Atlas of Pediatric Neurosurgical Operations , which was published in 1981.

Codding never married and had no close family. In her later years, she retired to Cape Cod, where she enjoyed making watercolor paintings of the scenes around her home. She died on August 3, 1991 at her home in Eastham, Massachusetts.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

did.unittitle: Proofs from Meningiomas by Mildred Codding

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Proofs from Cushing and Eisenhardt's Meningiomas (1938), organized by chapter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Folder contains 3 loose caption labels for Figs. 49, 53, and 54, and 2 proofs mounted on cardboard. One proof is labeled "Emma Hill."

did.unittitle: Chapter V - Combined Neurinomas and Meningiomas

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Folder contains 2 proofs mounted on cardboard, corresponding to Figs. 66 and 68 in Meningiomas . Fig. 66 is labeled "Goldman" and Fig. 68 is labeled "Dale Harvey."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Folder contains 3 mounted proofs corresponding to Meningiomas Figs. 84, 88, and 92. Figures are labeled in pencil "Edith Mindes I," "Mindes II," and "Mindes III" respectively.

did.unittitle: Chapter VII - Meningiomas without Dural Attachment

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Folder contains mounted proofs of Meningiomas Figs. 113 and 127. Fig. 113 is labeled in pencil "Montgomery" and "Transverse cleft." Fig. 127 is labeled "Nicholl" and "deep sylvian cleft."

did.unittitle: Chapter VIII - Cerebellar Chamber: Basilar Groove

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Folder contains 3 mounted proofs corresponding to Meningiomas Figs. 134 and 136. All illustrations pertain to the "Josephine Nilson" case.

did.unittitle: Chapter IX - Cerebellar Chamber: Subtentorial and Recess

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Folder contains 1 proof, corresponding to Meningiomas Fig. 148. Illustration is labeled "Hanrahan."

did.unittitle: Chapter X - Cerebellar Chamber: Those Simulating Acoustic Tumors

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains 1 proof mounted on cardboard, corresponding to Meningiomas Fig. 158. Proof is labeled "O'Toole."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains 7 proofs of various sizes mounted on cardboard, corresponding to Meningiomas Figs. 187, 195, 191, and 199A/B/C/D. Illustrations are labeled "Walkden" (187), "Steinberg" (191), and "Jackson" (195). Folder also contains two unmounted illustrations labeled "Anderson" corresponding to Figs. 183 and 184.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains 2 proofs mounted, corresponding to Meningiomas Figs. 205 and 219. Fig. 205 (labeled "Fig. 4") is an illustration signed by "S.A. Sewell," and caption notes that this image is "Kindness of Prof. Shattuck." Fig. 219 is labeled "Lampman."

did.unittitle: Chapter XV - Sphenoidal Ridge: Deep or Clinoidal Third

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Folder contains 2 proofs mounted on cardboard, corresponding to Meningiomas Figs. 239 and 249. Fig 239. is labeled "Hultin" and Fig. 249 is labeled "Mutter."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains 2 mounted proofs corresponding to Meningiomas Figs. 270 (unlabeled) and 274. Fig. 270 is labeled "Mary Partridge" and 274 is labeled "Furtado."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains 1 mounted proof, corresponding to Meningiomas Fig. 309. Illustration is labeled "Theriault."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains 3 proofs mounted on cardboard, corresponding to Meningiomas Figs. 343 (labeled on back in pencil), 372, and 373. Fig. 343 is "Doucette," Fig. 372 is "Parkhurst," and Fig. 373 is "Taylor."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains 1 proof mounted on paper and cardboard, corresponding to Fig. 585. Illustration is labeled "Pryzbos."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

did.unittitle: Notes and other materials relating to Meningiomas

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains notes, correspondence, photographs, illustrations, and other materials relating to the production of Harvey Cushing's Meningiomas , organized by chapter.

Although the original folders corresponding to each chapter were heavily disintegrated and are not included in this collection, the labels and any text that appeared on the folders themselves have been included. Materials that were found loose (i.e., not in a folder) have been sorted into the appropriate folders when possible.
Illustrations by Mildred Codding included in this series pertain to cases discussed in Meningiomas , but the illustrations themselves do not appear in the published monograph.

did.unittitle: Chapter I - Historical and Terminological & Chapter II - Pathology

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains proof of Fig. 4 (photograph) mounted on card; proof of Fig. 5 (photograph, labeled Fig. 7) mounted on paper; proof of Fig. 9 (photograph, labeled Fig. 10) mounted on paper; likely early version of Fig. 10 (illustration, labeled Fig. 12), showing differences from published figure; microscopy photograph labeled "Fig. 9. A cerebral hernia in the process of withdrawal from an arachnoid villus," mounted on paper; 2 detached images: 1 illustration, 1 photograph of a tumor (labeled on back "Fig. 10 Cavendish lecture"); and 2 proof sheets labeled "Fig. 1" and "Fig. 8" showing captions but no images.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains various handwritten notes in Cushing's handwriting; a card from "The Country Club" with Cushing's handwriting on back; and several typed pages, many pertaining to the Josephine Nilson case.

did.unittitle: Chapter IX - Cerebellar: Subtentorial and Recess

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains 4 mounted illustrations by Mildred Codding pertaining to Chapter IX cases: "Storer" and "Warme." Illustrations do not appear in Meningiomas , but were likely included in an earlier publication and consulted later by Cushing.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains original label from Suprasellar folder; 5 loose photographic reprints with citations and dates on back; and 1 mounted photographic reprint of "Fig. 1."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains 8 mounted photographic reprints labeled Figs. 3, 10, 11, 12, 13, 14, 15, and "22 & 23." The image labeled "Fig. 14" appears as Fig. 211 in Meningiomas . While other images do not appear in the text, all cases are cited on p. 253. Also contains 13 loose photographic reprints with labels on reverse; illustration (by Codding?) of "Lena Moscowitz" case; loose paper with writing in pencil reading "Fig. 14 used for olf. groove chapter"; and original folder label.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains original "Intraorbital" folder label and 1 photographic reprint with citation on reverse.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains a letter in French from Dr. Daniel Petit-Dutaillis, originally clipped to 2 photographic reprints of a brain; handwritten notes by Cushing; and 2 mounted illustrations by Codding: "Mary Partridge" and "Sullivan."

did.unittitle: Chapter XVIII - Sphenoidal Ridge: Sylvian Point

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains 1 mounted illustration by Codding, labeled "Sladkiovilno."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains 2 mounted illustrations by Codding, both labeled "Helen Thomas."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains front of original folder, showing patient list; loose notes on paper in Cushing's handwriting; and 10 illustrations by Codding: Leonard Wood, Jessie Wall, Charles F. Taylor (3x), McCarthy, Gerding, Mrs. Dain, Vosberg, Jeanie Wiesleder.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Folder contains front of original folder showing patient list; loose photographic reprints with citations on reverse; proof (photograph mounted on paper) of Fig. 428; proof (reprint in negative, mounted on paper) of Fig. 376; large sketch (folded) corresponding to Fig. 418 with notes on reverse; sketch corresponding to Fig. 419; correspondence from 1933 to Cushing signed "Robin;" 2 handwritten letters and 2 photographs (labeled "A658" on reverse); additional notes and correspondence; handwritten notes and sketches on card, apparently by Cushing; and an illustration by Codding on paper, consisting of several pieces of paper glued together, labeled "Hyperostosis 55."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains original "Peritorcular" folder label; photographic reprint with caption mounted on paper, labeled "James case;" and 3 illustrations by Codding: Erma Kennedy, Frank Hartz, and Woolson.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains 1 reprint of illustration by Codding, corresponding to Meningiomas Fig. 505.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Typed correspondence from S. Forrest Cowell, attached to "Catalogue description of Specimen No. 1454.1 in the Series of General Pathology;" handwritten notes by Cushing; list: "X-rays Frontal group."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Typed notes, 1 sheet; reprinted illustration by Codding corresponding to Fig. 522; mounted illustration by Codding labeled "Arthur Perlin;" and original Coronal folder label.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains 1 reprint of illustration by Codding corresponding to Fig. 534, and 4 mounted illustrations by Codding in ink: Maggie Wyman, Edna Rumney, Charles Goddard (2x).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains original folder label, various typed and handwritten notes, and a reprint of a Codding illustration.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Note that there is no chapter in Meningiomas corresponding to Occipital tumors because Cushing had no recorded cases of tumors of this type; see p. 564 in Meningiomas for discussion. Folder contains handwritten and typed notes, and original folder label.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains 3 mounted illustrations by Codding: Martha Caswell (2x) and Julia Jacobs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains 4 pages of typed notes and original "Differential Diagnoses" folder label, in Cushing's handwriting.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Original label (included) reads "Endothelioma - Misc. MS." Folder includes: 4 illustrations in pencil, blue pencil, and red ink similar to Meningiomas Fig. 504.; correspondence from E.R. Carpenter, attached to 3 photographs of brains with notes on back; typed copy or notes on yellow and white paper; 12 pages of what appear to be citations in Chinese and German; and handwritten copy on lined paper (not in Cushing's hand).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Original label (included) reads "Meningiomas - Misc. notes to put with original manuscript, etc. of different chapters." Contains 3 photographic reprints mounted on paper.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains 3 loose pieces of paper with handwritten notes, found with rest of collection, that could not be classified into folders.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Loose photographs and reprints relating to Meningiomas that could not be classified into a folder. Three of the photographs are mounted. There is also a letter from K.G. McKenzie to Cushing that was attached to 2 of the photos (labeled N49 on reverse).

did.unittitle: Illustrations from other publications by Codding

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Michael Hand, from the estate of Rosalie Marie Hand, 2013.

did.unittitle: Tumors Arising from the Blood Vessels of the Brain (Cushing and Bailey)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Full citation: Cushing, H. and Bailey, P. Tumors arising from the blood vessels of the brain: Angiomatous malformations and hemangioblastomas. Springfield, Ill.: Charles C. Thomas, 1928.
Contains 6 mounted proofs, corresponding to Figs. 5 (O'Laughlin), 60 (Dunn), 61 (Dunn), 91 (McAvoy?), 95 (McAvoy), and 130 (Gorden).

did.unittitle: "Electro-Surgery as an Aid to the Removal of Intracranial Tumors" (Cushing)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Full citation: Cushing, H. "Electro-surgery as an aid to the removal of intracranial tumors." With a preliminary note by W.T. Bovie, Ph.D., Chicago. Surg. Gynec. Obstet., Dec. 1928 (47): 751-784.
Folder contains 8 original illustrations in pencil on paper (unmounted) by Mildred Codding, corresponding to figures appearing in "Electro-surgery."

did.unittitle: "Meningiomas Arising from the Tuberculum Sellae" (Cushing and Eisenhardt)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Full citation: Cushing, H. and Eisenhardt, L. "Meningiomas arising from the tuberculum sellae: With the syndrome of primary optic atrophy and bitemporal field defects combined with a normal sella turcica in a middle aged person." Arch Ophthalmol. 1929;1(1):1-41 (Part 1) and 1929;1(2):168-206 (Part 2).

Folder contains 15 original illustrations in pencil on paper by Mildred Codding. Some are composites of illustrations on multiple sheets of paper glued together; others show multiple drafts of the same or similar illustrations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Full citation: Cushing, H. "The chiasmal syndrome: Of primary optic atrophy and bitemporal field defects in adults with a normal sella turcica." Arch Ophthalmol. 1930;3(5):505-551.
Folder contains 5 mounted proofs with captions illustrated by Mildred Codding, corresponding to Figs. 35, 40, 44, 45 (two versions), and 46.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Full citation: Cushing, H. "The chiasmal syndrome: Of primary optic atrophy and bitemporal field defects in adults with a normal sella turcica." Arch Ophthalmol. 1930;3(6):704-735.
Folder contains 4 mounted proofs with captions illustrated by Mildred Codding.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Folder contains 19 original illustrations in pencil on paper (unmounted) corresponding to various figures appearing in "Chiasmal Syndrome" Parts I and II (1930). Many are labeled with patient names and diagnoses on reverse.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Full citation: Cushing, H. "Neurohypophysial mechanisms from a clinical standpoint." Lancet, July 19, 26, 1930; 2: 119-127 (Part 1); 175-184 (Part 2).
The Lister Memorial Lecture delivered at the Royal College of Surgeons of England, July 9, 1930.
Contains 1 page of illustrations in pencil. Images do not appear in the Lancet publication, but may have been presented alongside the Lister Memorial Lecture (see footnote in article).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Full citation: Cushing, H. Intracranial tumors: Notes upon a series of two thousand verified cases with surgical-mortality percentages pertaining thereto. Springfield, Ill.: Charles C. Thomas, 1932.

Folder contains 15 illustrations (proofs and sketches) in pencil and pencil and ink by Mildred Codding corresponding to various figures in the 1932 Intracranial Tumors monograph. Final (proof) and early (sketch) versions of Figs. 37, 63, and 91 are included together for comparison.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Folder contains 1 proof and 13 sketches in pencil and pencil and ink by Mildred Codding. Many are labeled with patient names and/or diagnoses. The publications associated with these illustrations are unknown.

did.unittitle: Illustrations for Harvey Cushing by others
Proofs from H. Cushing and L.H. Weed's article in JHH Bulletin

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Full citation: Cushing, H. and Weed, L.H. "Studies on the cerebro-spinal fluid and its pathway, No. IX. Calcareous and osseous deposits in the arachnoidea." Johns Hopk. Hosp. Bull., 1915; 26(297): 367-372. Contains 3 proofs, corresponding to Figs. 7, 8, and 9.
Illustrations likely by M. Warner.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These mounted illustrations of microscopy slides appear to have been illustrated by M. Warner. Although these illustrations do not appear in "Meningiomas," their inclusion in the 2017 Robinson gift indicates that they may have been used in the production of the monograph in some way. Some, but not all, of the names on these illustrations correspond to cases in "Meningiomas."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Three illustrations of various sizes mounted on carboard, labeled Fig. 9, 10, and 11.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains 1 mounted illustration labeled "Croy" and signed in pencil by M. Warner.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains 3 mounted illustrations by M. Warner labeled "Hardwick."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains 1 mounted illustration labeled "McLean H&E."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains 1 mounted illustration labeled "Nilson."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains 1 mounted illustration labeled "Pinkney."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 1 mounted illustration. Cover sheet is labeled "Poor." Image is labeled "Endothelioma of Brain."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains 1 mounted illustration labeled "Agnes Pumphrey."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains 1 mounted illustration labeled "Catherine Riley."

did.unittitle: Sketch of mouth on JHH letterhead, likely by Cushing

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Folder contains a sketch of a mouth on Johns Hopkins Hospital letterhead, with notes in Cushing's handwriting. Cushing was known to make post-operative sketches directly on hospital letterhead.

did.unittitle: Proof from "Chronic Subdural Hematoma" (T.J. Putnam and H. Cushing)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains 1 full-color painting mounted on cardboard, labeled "Fig. 1." Illustrator unknown.
